comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It may be Palmers, but they should all get their hands out of their pockets.

comment.author: 48982730@N00
comment._content: After a bit of googling, it seems the location of the store was Park & Pitt streets.  Not sure which corner, though (streetview doesn't help much).

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: xamesm - Farmers was on the NW corner of Pitt and Park Streets.  This shot is looking north up Pitt Street.

comment.author: 65314660@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called All Favourite Photos, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 28304000@N00
comment._content: beachcomberaustralia:  Wasn't Walton's on the NW corner of Pitt and Park Streets, with Farmers on the NW corner of Pitt and Market?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Thanks albert3801 - I meant to say "Palmers" not Farmers in the comment above. Sorry for confusing everyone including myself - I must have had my brain in my, er, pocket too. I found this 1930s picture in the State Library site which shows Palmers at NW corner of Pitt and Park Streets, and Murdochs store on Park and George street. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=35628 I have no idea of the history of Waltons, but I still use a saucepan I bought there in the early 1980s.
